items.title: 1956: Official opening of refurbished Nulsen Haven.
23 September 1954
items.description: The Daily News article "A Father Speaks Up for Some the World Forgets" published.

items.title: 8 October 1954
items.description: Agreement to form the Mentally Incurable Children's Association (MICA) and election of office bearers, including inaugural President William R Burns.

items.title: 9 August 1955
items.description: "Dear Brutus" at 517 Great Eastern Highway, Redcliffe purchased as the first home for MICA.

items.title: 7 October 1956
items.description: The refurbished "Nulsen Haven" officially opened by Premier A R G Hawke, and Minister for Health Emil Nulsen.

items.title: September 1957
items.description: The first Women's Radio Service Club meeting held in Bunbury. Perth members later renamed themselves the "Wandana Club".

items.title: 21 November 1965
items.description: "Wedderburn" new Nulsen Haven hostel officially opened by Minister for Health the Hon G C McKinnon.
Nulsen Ladies' Auxiliary Opportunity Shoppe opens in Victoria Park.
Jane Marshall, radio presenter who spoke with family who had to leave call to tend to her child.
Commencement of resident training at Nulsen, leading an evolution in disability services.
Ms Jill Bennett appointed Matron to usher in a new era.

additionalContent.description: 1973: Commencement of resident training at Nulsen, leading an evolution in disability services.

items.title: May 1977
items.description: Nulsen commences its first May campaign, raising funds and publicity. A year later, the "horse raffle" became a major part of the May campaign for 14 years.

items.title: The Early 80's
items.description: Listen to Ea anim laboris sit laborum pariatur consectetur nostrud id aliquip cupidatat esse dolor do qui duis.
“Normalisation” formally adopted at Nulsen based on standards and principles embodied in report submitted by the Murdoch Group.

items.title: 2 October 1983
items.description: MICA formally becomes Nulsen Haven Association Inc (for the training and care of severely and profoundly Intellectually Handicapped People).

items.title: January 1987
items.description: Six residents from urgent wait list move into experimental group home at Yorna Road, Kalamunda.

items.title: July 1987
items.description: Landmark legislation Disability Services Act 1986 comes into effect.

items.title: April 1988
items.description: Implementation of 10-year Transition Plan commences with key components - the Personal Future Planning process, PASSING workshops and in-service workshops aimed at providing “information and inspiration”.

items.title: 8 May 1989
items.description: The first two residents move into their own home in the community, in Willetton.

items.title: May 1989
items.description: Independent Living Services commences, with around 40 community activities in place within 2 years.

items.title: Early 90's
items.description: Listen to Ea anim laboris sit laborum pariatur consectetur nostrud id aliquip cupidatat esse dolor do qui duis.

Mission Statement and Statement of Governing Principles developed and formalised.</br></br>‘To enable people with disability to achieve and maintain a valued quality of life as part of an accepting community.’
Western Australia establishes a Cabinet Minister for Disability and commences the Disability Services Commission (DSC), the first agency of its type in Australia.

additionalContent.description: 1994: Ms Jill Bennett retires after 25 years of faithful and dedicated service.

items.description: Ms Jill Bennett retires after 25 years of faithful and dedicated service. Mr Gordon Trewern, the then Accommodation Services Coordinator, takes over the role of Director of Nulsen on initially a 12-month term.

items.title: February 1995
items.description: A PASSING evaluation (a tool for analysing service quality according to Social Role Valorisation criteria) funded by the DSC took place, resulting in the development of an improvement framework.
Nulsen begins a new business venture named ‘Independent Administration’, to provide support to small non-government organisations with payroll, accounts and insurance services.

additionalContent.description: 1995: Nulsen Haven and Independent Administration signage outside 28 Burton St office.

items.title: 18 May 1997
items.description: Administration offices at 28 Burton Street Cannington open.

items.title: June 2000
items.description: Mrs Peg Parkin accepts the inaugural “Award for Service Excellence” from the DSC in recognition of exceeding the quality requirements of the national disability standards in the accommodation support services provided at Rosella Place and Cardington Way.

additionalContent.description: 2000: Mrs Peg Parkin accepts the inaugural “Award for Service Excellence.

items.description: Nulsen develops its operational relationships with St John of God Hospital in Murdoch, local general practitioners and dental clinics to better manage the health and needs of aging residents.
Scope Community Integration Services commence providing activities for residents to enhance their skills and social development through community-based daytime options.

items.title: Our Leaders
items.description: Listen to Gordo as he Officia dolore ea laborum commodo anim Aliqua enim ad excepteur et.
The Nulsen Ladies Auxiliary and Southwest Radio Clubs celebrate their 50th anniversaries.

items.title: January 2006
items.description: White Place, Subiaco opens to expand Nulsen’s accommodation services to include support for people with Acquired Brain Injury as well as in-home support.

additionalContent.description: 2006: Nulsen Youth Patrons from Hale School.

items.title: January 2006
items.description: The Nulsen Youth Patron Program is launched in partnership with Hale School.

items.title: August 2008
items.description: Charlesworth Estate opens, a significant milestone for families and residents.
Nulsen Therapy achieves preferred provider status with the DSC for Disability Professional Services, a major acknowledgement of skill and competence.
Reconciliation Action Plan (RAP) launched, the first by a disability services organisation in WA.

additionalContent.description: 2008: The Melbourne Cup celebration at Charlesworth Estate.

items.description: Nulsen Therapy achieves preferred provider status with the DSC for Disability Professional Services, a major acknowledgement of skill and competence.

items.title: November 2009
items.description: Nulsen Haven Association rebrands to Nulsen Disability Services.
Nulsen Haven Association rebrands to Nulsen Disability Services.

items.title: Our Support Workers
items.description: Listen to Angie, Wendy & Tanya as they ficia dolore ea laborum commodo anim Aliqua enim ad excepteur et.

Partnership with Goldfields Individual and Family Support Association (GIFSA) to provide culturally appropriate disability accommodation supports for six Aboriginal people, enabling them to return to Country from an aged care facility in Perth.

additionalContent.description: 2010: Ms Kathy Rouse and Greg Barr enjoying gardening together at City Farm.

items.description: Media personality Ms Tina Altieri retires as Nulsen Patron after 13 years. Mr Malcolm McCusker AC, Governor of Western Australia, accepts the invitation to become new Patron.

items.title: May 2013
items.description: National Disability Insurance Scheme Act 2013 proclaimed in Federal Parliament, establishing the National Disability Insurance Agency.

additionalContent.description: 2013: Nulsen partners with GIFSA to open a new home in Kalgoorlie.

items.title: July 2014
items.description: NDIS trial sites commence in WA.

items.title: Our Colleagues
items.description: Listen to Barry as he ficia dolore ea laborum commodo anim Aliqua enim ad excepteur et.
Nulsen commences supports to 40 people moving from six state government disability accommodation services.

items.title: 1 July 2016
items.description: National launch of the NDIS.

items.title: September 2016
items.description: Nulsen Opportunity Shoppe in Victoria Park closes after 50 years of community service.
Nulsen Disability Services Group rebrands to Nulsen Disability Services.

additionalContent.description: Nulsen Opportunity Shoppe in Victoria Park served 50 years of community service.

items.title: Our Supports
items.description: Listen to Ethel, Ruth & Eddie ficia dolore ea laborum commodo anim Aliqua enim ad excepteur et.
Nulsen’s total revenue exceeds $50 million for the first time, supporting 253 services, including 206 residents in accommodation support services.

items.title: December 2017
items.description: Bilateral Agreement between Australian and WA Governments signed following decision to join national NDIS.
Nulsen Group formed to provide governance model to allow for growth alongside Nulsen Disability Services.
Nulsen Group formed to provide governance model to allow for growth alongside Nulsen Disability Services, largely influenced by NDIS funding uncertainty.

items.title: January 2018
items.description: NDIS Quality and Safeguards Commission commences.
